Key Arguments: The bill undermines freedom of speech by attempting to balance it with combating misinformation.
Fundamental rights should not be balanced against other considerations.
The Covid-19 pandemic showed that public health authorities can present false information.
Determining misinformation is subjective and should not be entrusted to a government agency.
Misinformation does not cause direct harm unless it incites violence.
The bill grants excessive control to authorities and will lead to censorship.
Alternative approaches should be explored that do not infringe upon freedom of speech.
Notable Quotes: Fundamental rights cannot be balanced against anything, rather they are undermined.
Determining what qualifies as so-called misinformation/disinformation is subjective and entrusting a government agency to decide truthfulness raises concerns.
